Posts.Content: I have just looked it up on this Macmillan site and its only secondary if you are stage 4...ie when it's spread elsewhere to other parts of the body. Basically it is more advanced if it's gone in the lymth nodes under the arm but it is not classed has secondary cancer...xx
Posts.Title: 120mm tumour

Posts.Content: yes there's definitely a confusion here...it is not secondary  unless its spread beyond lymth nodes and gone to distant parts of the body or unless you are stage 4..x.
Posts.Title: 120mm tumour

Posts.Content: Hiya, so are you stage 4 then?  see its confusing isnt it? stage 4 is when its spread further which basically means its secondary and terminal...xxx
Posts.Title: 120mm tumour

Posts.Content: Hi, Who told you it was secondary cancer? it is not secondary cancer when it spreads in to your lymph glands under your arm. i had a 5cm tumor and mine went in to ALL 25 lymph glands. i had a CT scan and it hadn't spread thankfully. As far as i know it is only secondary if it's spread in to your liver,lungs, bones and brains. Mine was stage 3A . Are you stage 4? i always think to myself that my lymth glands did a pretty good job of stopping the cancer going any further.. Keep being positive..:) Karen xx
